src: Опустите руку што више, трудећи се да и даље правилно погађате све ноте - такође, пробајте да сведете непотребне покрете прстију на минимум. На овај начин ћете се што је мање могуће умарати. Запамтите да нема потребе да дирке притискате великом снагом да бисте добили додатну јачину звука, као што је то на клавиру. Да бисте добили додатну јачину звука на хармоници, користите мехове са више притиска или брзине.
mt: Try to keep your hands as still as possible, trying to accurately hit all the notes - also, try to minimize unnecessary finger movements. This will help you not to get tired. Remember that there is no need to press the keys with great force to get more volume, as on the piano. To get more volume on the harmonica, use more pressure or speed reeds.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Оверсцан је један од најчешћих проблема који се јавља када желите да филм конвертујете у DVD формат. Већина телевизија се прави на начин који ће задовољити широку публику. Из тог разлога, све што видите на ТВ-у има изрезане ивице на врху, дну и на странама. Ово се ради како би се слика приказивала преко целог екрана. То се назива „корекцијом ивице екрана“. Нажалост, када правите DVD, његове ивице ће вероватно такође бити исечене, а ако видео има титлове који су превише близу доњем делу ивице, неће се видети у потпуности.
mt: Overscan is one of the most common problems when you want to convert a video to DVD format. Most TVs are made in a way that will satisfy a wide audience. For this reason, everything you see on TV has cropped edges at the top, bottom and sides. This is done so that the image can be displayed across the entire screen. This is called "screen edge correction". Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, its edges will probably be cut off as well, and if the video has subtitles that are too close to the bottom edge, they will not be seen completely.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Амерички план је почивао на спровођењу координираних напада из три различита правца. Генерал Џон Кодволдер би покренуо диверзиони напад на британски гарнизон у Бордентауну како би спречио појачање. Генерал Џејмс Јуинг би повео 700 припадника милиције преко реке код Трентон Ферија, преузео би мост преко потока Асанпинк и спречио би непријатељске трупе да побегну. Главни нападачки одред од 2400 мушкараца прешао би реку девет миља од Трентона, а онда се поделио у две групе, једну под вођством Грина и једну под вођством Саливана, како би напад извршили пре зоре.
mt: The American plan was based on coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John J. Codwell would launch a diversionary attack on the British garrison at Bordentown to prevent reinforcements. General James E. Yeager would lead 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, take the bridge over Assunpink Creek and block the enemy's retreat. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles from Trenton, then split into two groups, one under Greene's command and one under Sullivan's command, to attack before dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: Након усвајања од стране Конгреса 4. јула, ручно писани нацрт који су потписали преседник Конгреса Џон Хенкок и секретар Чарлс Томсон послат је неколико блокова даље, до штампарије Џона Данлапа. У току ноћи је направљено између 150 и 200 примерака, сада познатих под именом „Данлапове стране“. Џон Никсон је први јавно прочитао овај документ, 8. јула у дворишту Дворане независности. Један примерак је послат Џорџу Вашингтону 6. јулаа прочитана је његовим трупама 9. јула у Њујорку. Једна копија је стигла у Лондон 10. августа. 25 Данлапових списа за које се још увек зна да постоје су најстарије постојеће копије документа. Оригинал који је ручно написан није сачуван.
mt: After its passage by Congress on July 4, the handwritten draft that was signed by Congress President John Hancock and Secretary Charles Thomson was sent a few blocks further, to the John Dunlap's print shop. During the night, between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as the "Dunlap broadsides". John Nixon was the first to publicly read this document, on July 8 in the Independence Hall courtyard. One copy was sent to George Washington on July 6, and read to his troops on July 9 in New York. A copy arrived in London on August 10. 25 Dunlap broadsides that are still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten document is not preserved.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Колонисти су, видећи ову активност, такође звали појачање. Трупе које су ојачавале предње положаје укључивале су 1. и 3. њухемпширски пук од 200 мушкараца, вођен под пуковницима Џон Старком и Џејмс Ридом (обојица су касније постали генерали). Старкови људи су заузели позиције дуж ограде на северном крају позиција Колониста. Када је осека створила јаз дуж Мистичне реке дуж североистока полуострва, брзо су продужили ограду кратким каменим зидом према северу, који се завршавао на ивици воде на малој плажи. Гридли или Старк су поставили колац на 100 стопа (30 m) испред ограде и наредили су да нико не пуца док регрути не прођу.
mt: Colonists, seeing this activity, also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the front lines included the 1st and 3rd Battalions of the Hampshire Regiment, commanded by Major John Stark and Major James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the northern edge of the Colonists' positions. When the gap created a chasm along the Mystic River to the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north, which ended at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a cannon 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the recruits had passed.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: Древна Кина је имала јединствен начин приказивања различитих временских периода; сваки период Кине или свака породица која је била на власти представљали су посебну династију. Такође је између сваке династије било нестабилно доба подељених провинција. Најпознатији период од свих била је епоха Три краљевства која је трајала шездесет година између династија Хан и Јин. Током овог периода дешавало се жестоко ратовање између многих племића који су се борили за престо. Три краљевства су била један од најкрвавијих периода у историји древне Кине. Хиљаде људи је погинуло у борби за престо у огромној палати у Си'ану.
mt: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each period of China or each family that was in power represented a separate dynasty. There was also an unstable period between each dynasty of divided provinces. The most famous period of all was the era of the Three Kingdoms which lasted sixty years between the Han and Jin dynasties. During this period there was fierce warring between many nobles who fought for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest periods in the history of ancient China. Thousands of people died in the fight for the throne in the enormous palace in Xi'an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Војска колонија мрава маршира и такође се гнезди у различитим фазама. Током номадске фазе, мрави војници марширају ноћу, а дању праве паузу и формирају камп. Колонија започиње своју номадску фазу кад се доступна храна смањи. У току ове фазе, колонија прави привремене мравињаке који се мењају сваког дана. Ове номадске миграције или маршеви углавном трају око 17 дана.
mt: Army ant colonies march and also nest in different phases. During the nomadic phase, army ant soldiers march at night, and during the day they take a break and form a camp. The colony begins its nomadic phase when the available food is reduced. During this phase, the colony makes temporary ant nests that are changed every day. These nomadic migrations or marches usually last about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Многи запажени ритмови у физиологији и понашању често пресудно зависе од присуства ендогених циклуса и њихове производње путем биолошких сатова. Периодични биолошки ритмови који нису само одговори на периодично смењивање спољашњих утицаја су забележени код већине живих организама, укључујући бактерије, гљиве, биљке и животиње. Биолошки сатови су самоодрживи осцилатори који ће наставити са периодом обртања слободног трчања, чак и ако нема спољних знакова.
mt: Many prominent rhythms in physiology and behavior often depend critically on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production via biological clocks. Periodic biological rhythms that are not just responses to periodically varying external influences have been observed in most living organisms, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self-sustaining oscillators that will continue with a free-running period of rotation even if there are no external cues.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Популација је скуп организама одређене врсте унутар датог географског подручја. Када су све јединке у популацији идентичне у погледу одређене фенотипске особине, познате су као мономорфне. Када појединци показују неколико варијанти одређене карактеристике, они су полиморфни.
mt: A population is a group of organisms of the same species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical in regard to a particular phenotypic trait, they are known as monomorphic. When individuals exhibit several variants of a trait, they are polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Популација је скуп организама одређене врсте унутар датог географског подручја. Када су све јединке у популацији идентичне у погледу одређене фенотипске особине, познате су као мономорфне. Када појединци показују неколико варијанти одређене карактеристике, они су полиморфни.

src: Туризам заснован на природи привлачи људе који су заинтересовани за посете природним подручјима, а у сврху уживања у пејзажу, укључјујући биљни и животињски свет дивљине. У активности на терену спадају на пример: лов, пецање, фотографисање, посматрање птица, посећивање паркова и проучавање података о екосистему. Пример је посећивање, фотографисање и учење о орангутанима у Борнеу.
mt: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas, for the purpose of enjoying the landscape, including the plant and animal life of the wild. Activities on the ground include, for example: hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, visiting parks and studying data on the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing and learning about orangutans in Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Сваког јутра људи напуштају мала сеоска места аутомобилима да би отишли до својих радних места, при чему се мимоилазе са онима чије се радно место налази управо на месту које су управо напустили. У овом динамичном транспортном процесу, сви су некако повезани и подржавају транспортни систем заснован на приватним аутомобилима. Наука сада указује на то да је ова економија велике потрошње угљеника помакла биосферу из једног од њених стабилних стања које је потпомагало еволуцију човека у последњих два милиона година.
mt: Every morning people leave small rural villages in cars to go to their workplaces, passing each other on the way. In this dynamic transport process, everyone is somehow connected and supports a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this economy of large consumption of carbon has moved the biosphere out of one of its stable states that has supported human evolution in the last two million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Атом се може сматрати једном од основних јединица грађе све материје. То је веома сложена целина која се, према упрошћеном Боровом моделу, састоји од централног језгра око кога круже електрони, донекле слично планетама које круже око Сунца – види слику 1.1. Нуклеус се састоји од две честице - неутрона и протона. Протони имају позитивно наелектрисање док неутрони немају наелектрисање. Електрони имају негативно наелектрисање.
mt: An atom can be considered one of the basic units of matter. It is a very complex entity which, according to the simplified Bohr model, consists of a central nucleus around which electrons orbit, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the Sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have positive charge while neutrons have no charge. Electrons have negative charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Практично сви компјутери који се данас употребљавају су засновани на руковању информацијама које су кодиране у облику бинарних бројева. Бинарни број може да има само једну од две вредности, тј. 0 или 1, а ови бројеви се називају бинарним цифрама - или битовима у рачунарском жаргону.
mt: Practically all computers in use today are based on manipulating information encoded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, 0 or 1, and these numbers are called binary digits or bits in computer jargon.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: Практично сви компјутери који се данас употребљавају су засновани на руковању информацијама које су кодиране у облику бинарних бројева. Бинарни број може да има само једну од две вредности, тј. 0 или 1, а ови бројеви се називају бинарним цифрама - или битовима у рачунарском жаргону.

ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: Блогови такође могу помоћи у побољшању писања код ученика. Иако студенти своје искуство са блоговима често започињу неуредном граматиком и правописом, присуство публике то углавном промени. Пошто су студенти често највише критички настројена публика, писац блога почиње да се труди да поправи писање како би избегао критику. Такође, блоговање „приморава студенте да постану сналажљивији у погледу света који их окружује”. Потреба да се подстакне интересовање публике надахњује ученике да буду паметни и занимљиви (Тото, 2004). Блоговање је алат који надахњује сарадњу и подстиче ученике да прошире учење и ван традиционалног школског дана. Одговарајућа употреба блогова „може оснажити ученике да постану аналитичнији и критичнији; кроз активно реаговање на материјале са интернета, студенти могу да дефинишу своје ставове у контексту туђих текстова, као и да изнесу сопствене перспективе о одређеним питањима (Оравец, 2002).
mt: Blogs can also help improve writing skills. Although students often begin their blogging experience with poor grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience usually improves this. Because students are often the most critical audience, the blogger begins to try to improve his writing to avoid criticism. Also, blogging “forces students to become more aware of the world around them.” The need to engage an audience inspires students to be smart and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration and encourages students to expand learning beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs “can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through active response to materials on the Internet, students can define their positions in the context of other texts, as well as articulate their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002).
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Асинхрона комуникација пружа време за рефлексију и реакцију према другима. Допушта ученицима могућност да раде по сопственом темпу и да имају контролу над темпом упутстава. Поред тога, постоји мање временских ограничења са могућношћу флексибилног радног времена. (Бремер, 1998. година) Употреба интернета и светске комуникационе мреже допушта сталан приступ информација онима који желе да уче. Студенти такође могу да доставе питања инструкторима у било које доба дана и могу очекивати прилично брзе одговоре, уместо да чекају до наредног термина консултација.
mt: Asynchronous communication allows time for reflection and response to others. It allows students the opportunity to work at their own pace and have control over the pace of instructions. In addition, there are fewer time constraints with the possibility of flexible work hours. (Bremner, 1998) The use of the Internet and the world communication network allows constant access to information to those who want to learn. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and can expect fairly quick responses, instead of waiting until the next term consultation.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Традиционални средњовековни замак одавно буди машту, призивајући слике витешких борби, гозби и артуријанског витештва. Чак и стојећи усред хиљаду година старих рушевина лако је подсетити се звукова и мириса давно извојеваних битака, скоро па чути звецкање копита по калдрми и намирисати страх како се диже из тамница. Али да ли се наша машта заснива на стварности? Зашто су замкови уопште грађени? Како су пројектовани и грађени?
mt: The traditional medieval castle has long been a source of inspiration, conjuring up images of knightly battles, feasts and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst a thousand-year-old ruin, it is easy to recall the sounds and smells of long-fought battles, almost hearing the clatter of hooves on the cobblestones and smelling the fear rising from the dungeons. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Типично за овај период, замак Кирби Макслоу је више утврђена кућа него прави замак. Његови велики застакљени прозори и танки зидови не би дуго могли да се одупру одлучном нападу. Када је Лорд Хејстингс започео његову изградњу 1480-их, земља је била релативно мирна и одбрана је била потребна само од малих банди лутајућих пљачкаша.
mt: Typically for this period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have long resisted a determined assault. When Lord Hastings began its construction in the 1480s, the land was relatively peaceful and defence was only needed from small bands of wandering marauders.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Повећавањем раздаљине са четвртине на пола миље, брзина почиње да игра много мању улогу, а издржљивост постаје апсолутно неопходна. Наравно, првокласни тркач на пола миље, човек који може да истрчи стазу за мање од два минута, мора да поседује приличну брзину, али издржљивост мора да се развија у свакој прилици. Нешто трчања по природи током зиме у комбинацији са гимнастичким вежбама за горњи део тела је најбоља припрема за сезону трчања.
mt: By increasing the distance from a quarter to a half mile, speed begins to play a much smaller role, and endurance becomes absolutely necessary. Of course, a first-class half-miler, a man who can run the track in less than two minutes, must possess a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be developed at all times. A little running in the open during the winter in combination with upper-body calisthenics is the best preparation for the running season.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Исправне навике у ишрани не могу саме да доведу до најбољих перформанси, али могу да значајно утичу на свеукупно стање младих спортиста. Одржавање здраве енергетске равнотеже, примена ефикасних навика хидрације и разумевање различитих аспеката примене суплемената може помоћи спортистима да побољшају своје перформансе и повећају своје уживање у спорту.
mt: Proper nutrition alone cannot lead to the best performance, but it can significantly affect the overall state of young athletes. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, the application of effective hydration practices and understanding the different aspects of the use of supplements can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of sports.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Исправне навике у ишрани не могу саме да доведу до најбољих перформанси, али могу да значајно утичу на свеукупно стање младих спортиста. Одржавање здраве енергетске равнотеже, примена ефикасних навика хидрације и разумевање различитих аспеката примене суплемената може помоћи спортистима да побољшају своје перформансе и повећају своје уживање у спорту.
mt: Proper nutrition alone cannot lead to the best performance, but it can significantly affect the overall state of young athletes. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, the application of effective hydration practices and understanding the different aspects of the use of supplements can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of sports.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Трчање на средње пруге је релативно јефтин спорт; међутим, постоји много заблуда у вези неколико делова опреме која вам је неопходна за учествовање. Производи се могу купити по потреби, али већина ће имати мали или уопште неће имати утицај на перформансе. Спортисти ће можда осећати да више воле неки производ чак и кад он не пружа стварне користи.
mt: Track and field is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions about several pieces of equipment that you need to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no effect on performance. Athletes may feel they prefer some product even when it does not provide real benefits.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: MRT је заснована на физичком феномену који се зове нуклеарна магнетна резонанца (NMR), коју су открили Феликс Блох 1930. године (радећи на Универитету Стенфорд) и Едвард Персел (са Универзитета Харвард). У овој резонанци, магнетно поље и радио таласи чине да атоми пуштају мале радио сигнале. Рејмонд Дамадиан, лекар и научни истраживач, открио је 1970. године основу за коришћење магнетне резонанце као алата за медицинску дијагнозу. Четири године касније патент је одобрен, а то је био први објављен патент из области MRT (Магнетне резонантне томографије) на свету. Доктор Дамадиан је завршио изградњу првог „цело тело“ MR скенера 1977. године, а назвао га је „Неукротив“.
mt: MRT is based on the physical phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered by Felix Bloch in 1930 (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, a magnetic field and radio waves make atoms emit small radio signals. Raymond Damadian, a physician and scientific researcher, discovered in 1970 the basis for using magnetic resonance as a medical diagnostic tool. Four years later the patent was approved, and it was the first published patent in the field of MRI (Magnetic Resonance Tomography) in the world. Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first "whole body" MR scanner in 1977, and named it "Unfathomable".
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Људи су далеко најталентованија врста у читању мисли других људи. То значи да смо у могућности да успешно предвидимо шта други људи осећају, намеравају, верују, знају или желе. Међу овим способностима, разумевање намера других је кључно. Оно нам омогућава да разрешимо могуће двосмислености физичких радњи. На пример, ако бисте видели некога како разбија прозор аутомобила, вероватно бисте претпоставили да покушава да украде ауто неког непознатог човека. Требало би да му се другачије суди кад би изгубио кључеве аутомобила и кад би покушавао да провали у свој сопствени аутомобил.
mt: People are the most talented at reading the minds of other people. This means that we are able to successfully predict what other people feel, intend, believe, know, or want. Among these abilities, understanding the intentions of others is key. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities in physical actions. For example, if you saw someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume that they were trying to steal a car from an unknown person. You should judge them differently if they had lost their car keys and were trying to break into their own car.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Иако ВИ вуче снажну конотацију ка научној фантастици, ВИ је врло важна грана рачунарске науке која се бави понашањем, учењем и интелигентном адаптацијом машина. Истраживања на пољу вештачке интелигенције обухватају прављење машина како би се аутоматизовали задаци који захтевају интелигентно понашање. Примери укључују контролу, планирање и распоређивање, способност да се одговори на дијагнозе и питања клијената, као и препознавање рукописа, гласа и лица. Такве ствари су постале одвојене дисциплине које се фокусирају на пружање решења за реалне животне проблеме. Систем вештачке интелигенције (AI) се сад често користи на пољу економије, медицине, инжињеринга и у војне сврхе, с обзиром да је уграђен у неколико кућних компјутера и софтвер апликација за видео игрице.
mt: While AI has a strong connotation with science fiction, AI is a very important branch of computer science that deals with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation of machines. Research in the field of artificial intelligence includes making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to respond to diagnoses and customer questions, as well as handwriting, speech and face recognition. Such things have become separate disciplines that focus on providing solutions to real life problems. AI systems are now commonly used in the field of economics, medicine, engineering and military purposes, being embedded in many home computers and video game software applications.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Конвергентни обрасци мишљења су технике за решавање проблема које уједињују различите идеје или области у циљу проналаска решења. Фокус овог начина размишљања су брзина, логика и прецизност, као и идентификовање чињеница, поновна примена постојећих техника, сакупљање информација. Најважнији фактор овог начина размишљања је: да постоји само један тачан одговор. Мислите само на два одговора, наиме тачан или погрешан. Ова врста размишљања повезана је са одређеним научним или стандардним поступцима. Људи са оваквим типом размишљања  размишљају логички, имају способност да памте шаблоне, решавају проблеме и раде на научним тестовима.
mt: Convergent thinking techniques are methods for solving problems that bring together different ideas or areas in order to find a solution. The focus of this way of thinking are speed, logic and precision, as well as identifying facts, reusing existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this way of thinking is: there is only one correct answer. Think only about two answers, namely correct or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain scientific or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking think logically, have the ability to remember patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: Употреба видео снимања је довела до значајних открића у интерпретацији микро експресија, фацијалних покрета који трају неколико милисекунди. Нарочито се тврди да, ако тачно тумачите микроизразе, можете да уочите да ли нека особа лаже. Оливер Сакс је у свом раду Председников говор назначио како људи који нису у стању да разумеју говор због оштећења мозга ипак могу тачно да процене искреност. Он чак сматра да такве способности у разумевању људског понашања можда имају и животиње попут домаћих паса.
mt: Video analysis has led to significant discoveries in interpreting micro-expressions, facial movements that last a few milliseconds. It is particularly claimed that, if you interpret micro-expressions accurately, you can detect whether someone is lying. Oliver Sacks in his work The President's Speech noted how people who are unable to understand speech due to brain damage can accurately judge sincerity. He even considers that such abilities in understanding human behavior may have animals such as domestic dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Како се способност стицања знања и учења мењала на горе поменут начин, промењена је и основна стопа по којој је знање стечено. Приступ усвајању информација је био другачији. Притисак више није био на појединачном присећању, већ је већи фокус стављен на способност да се упамти текст. У суштини, ренесанса је донела значајну промену у приступу учењу и дисеминацији знања.
mt: As the ability to acquire knowledge and learning changed in the above manner, the basic rate at which knowledge was acquired also changed. The approach to acquiring information was different. Pressure was no longer on individual recall, but a greater focus was placed on the ability to remember text. In essence, the Renaissance brought a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: Како се способност стицања знања и учења мењала на горе поменут начин, промењена је и основна стопа по којој је знање стечено. Приступ усвајању информација је био другачији. Притисак више није био на појединачном присећању, већ је већи фокус стављен на способност да се упамти текст. У суштини, ренесанса је донела значајну промену у приступу учењу и дисеминацији знања.
mt: As the ability to acquire knowledge and learning changed in the above manner, the basic rate at which knowledge was acquired also changed. The approach to acquiring information was different. Pressure was no longer on individual recall, but a greater focus was placed on the ability to remember text. In essence, the Renaissance brought a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: Интернет комбинује елементе и масовне и међуљудске комуникације. Јединствене карактеристике интернета су довеле до додатних димензија у погледу употреба и приступа задовољењу. На пример, „учење“ и „социјализација“ се наводе као важне сврхе коришћења интернета (Џејмс и др., 1995). Ејмеј и Мекорд (1998) су при истраживању реакција публике на веб сајтове идентификовали „лично учешће“ и „одржаване везе“ као нове мотивационе аспекте.
mt: The Internet combines elements of mass and interpersonal communication. Unique characteristics of the Internet have led to additional dimensions in terms of use and access to satisfy. For example, "learning" and "socialization" are cited as important purposes of Internet use (James et al., 1995). Aimee and McCardle (1998) in their study of public reaction to web sites identified "personal involvement" and "maintained connections" as new motivational aspects.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Готички стил достигао је врхунац у периоду између 10 - 11. века и 14. века. На почетку је одевање било под снажним утицајем византијске културе на истоку. Међутим, због спорих канала комуникације, стилови на западу би могли да буду у заостатку неких 25 до 30 година. Крајем средњег века, западна Европа је почела да развија сопствени стил. Један од највећих изума тог доба као резултат крсташких ратова било је коришћење дугмади за причвршћивање одеће.
mt: Gothic style reached its peak between the 10th and 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning, the fashion was under the strong influence of Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the disputed communication channels, styles on the west could be behind by 25 to 30 years. At the end of the Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own style. One of the greatest inventions of that time as a result of the Crusades was the use of buttons for fastening clothes.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Можемо почети да живимо више пријатељски настројени према животној средини, можемо се придружити еколошком покрету, а чак можемо постати и активисти како бисмо донекле смањили страдање у будућности. У многим случајевима је ово као симптоматско лечење. Међутим, ако не желимо само привремено решење, требало би да пронађемо корен проблема, и да их угасимо. Сасвим је очигледно да се свет много променио услед научног и технолошког напретка човечанства, а проблеми су постали већи због пренасељености и екстравагантног начина живота човечанства.
mt: We can start living more friendly towards the environment, we can join the ecological movement, and we can even become activists in order to reduce the suffering in the future. In many cases this is like symptomatic treatment. However, if we do not want only a temporary solution, we should find the root of the problem, and extinguish it. It is quite obvious that the world has changed a lot due to scientific and technological progress of mankind, and the problems have become bigger due to overpopulation and extravagant way of life of mankind.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Равнотежа моћи је био систем којим су европске нације покушале да одрже суверенитет свих европских држава. Концепт је био такав да су све европске нације морале да покушају да спрече једну нацију да постане моћна, и стога су националне владе често мењале своје савезнике како би одржале баланс. Рат за шпанско наслеђе је био први рат где је главни проблем био равнотежа моћи. Ово је означило важну промену, с обзиром да европске силе више нису имале изговор да су то верски ратови. Стога, Тридесетогодишњи рат је био последњи рат који је означен као верски рат.
mt: The Balance of Power was a system by which European nations tried to keep the sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to try to prevent one nation from becoming too powerful, and so national governments often changed their allies to keep the balance. The War of the Spanish Succession was the first war where the main problem was the Balance of Power. This marked an important change, as European powers no longer had an excuse to call them religious wars. So, the Thirty Years' War was the last war to be called a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Током овог периода европске историје, над Католичком црквом, која је постала богата и моћна, почео је да се врши надзор. Хришћанска религија је хиљадама година повезивала европске тржаве, упркос разликама у језику и обичајима. Својом неисцрпном моћи утицала је на свакога, од краља до обичног човека. Једно од главних хришћанских принципа је да богатство треба бити коришћено да се ублаже патња и сиромаштво и да монетарни фондови цркве постоје управо из тог разлога. Централна власт цркве била је у Риму више од хиљаду година и ова концентрација моћи и новца довела је до тога да се многи питају да ли се ово начело испуњава.
mt: During this period of European history, over the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, began to be monitored. The Christian religion had connected European markets for thousands of years, despite differences in language and customs. Its inexhaustible power influenced everyone, from kings to ordinary people. One of the main Christian principles is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the Church's monetary funds exist precisely for that reason. The central power of the Church was in Rome for more than a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to wonder if this principle is fulfilled.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: Преплашени краљ Луј XVI, краљица Марија Антоанета и њихово двоје мале деце (11-годишња Марија Тереса и четворогодишњи Луј-Шарл), као и краљева сестра, мадам Елизабет, натерани су 6. октобра 1789. године да се повуку у Парис из Версаја, а на то их је натерала руља жена са пијаце. Путовали су натраг у Париз кочијом, окружени руљом људи који су вриштали и узвикивали претње упућене краљу и краљици. Руља је наредила краљу и краљици да широм отворе прозоре кочије. У једном тренутку члан руље је пред престрављеном краљицом махао главом краљевског гардисте убијеног у Версају.
mt: 6 October 1789, the terrified Louis XVI, Marie Antoinette and their two young children (11-year-old Marie-Thérèse and four-year-old Louis-Charles), as well as the king's sister, Madame Élisabeth, were forced to retreat from Versailles to Paris, and were driven back to Paris in a coach, surrounded by a mob of people who were screaming and shouting threats directed at the king and queen. The mob ordered the king and queen to open the windows of the coach. At one point, a member of the mob waved his head at the terrified queen of the royal guard killed in Versailles.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Одмах након избијања непријатељства, Британија је започела поморску блокаду Немачке. Показало се да је стратегија ефективна, јер је прекинула доток кључних војних и цивилних залиха, мада је овом блокадом прекршен генерално прихваћен међународни закон кодификован у неколико међународних уговора у последња два века. Британија је минирала међународне воде како би спречила да било који брод уђе у читаве делове океана, изазивајући тиме опасност чак и неутралним бродовима. Будући да одговори на ову тактику били лимитирани, Немачка је очекивала сличан одговор на своју политику неограниченог подморског вођења рата.
mt: Immediately after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain began a naval blockade of Germany. It proved effective in cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated the generally accepted international law codified in several international treaties in the previous two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ship from entering entire parts of the ocean, thus posing a danger even to neutral ships. Given the limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its policy of unrestricted submarine warfare.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: Широм Сједињених Америчких Држава познато је приближно 400.000 случајева мултипле склерозе (МС), што је чини водећом неуролошком болешћу код млађих особа и особа средњих година. МС је болест која утиче на централни нервни систем, који чине мозак, кичмена мождина и видни живац. Истраживање је показало да је два пута вероватније да жене имају симптоме МС него мушкарци.
mt: 400,000 cases of multiple sclerosis (MS) are known in the United States, making it the leading neurological disease among younger people and those of middle age. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which includes the brain, spinal cord and optic nerve. Research has shown that women are twice as likely to have MS symptoms as men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Истраживање је показало да депресија, страх и представљање ситуације катастрофалном утичу на везу између бола и инвалидитета код оних који пате од бола у доњем делу леђа. Само ефекти катастрофирања, а не депресија и страх били су услов за редовне седмичне структурисане физичке активности Они који учествују у редовним активностима су захтевали већу подршку, када су у питању негативне перцепције бола, разликујући хронични бол и осећај нелагодности од нормалног физичког кретања.
mt: Research has shown that depression, fear and catastrophizing affect the link between pain and disability in those suffering from lower back pain. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear, were a condition for regular weekly structured physical activity. Those who participate in regular activities have demanded greater support when negative perceptions of pain are in question, distinguishing chronic pain and discomfort from normal physical movement.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: Модеран спорт мачевање се игра на многим нивоима, од студената на универзитету па до професионалаца и такмичара на Олимпијади. Спорт се примарно игра у формату дуела, један мачевалац против другог.
mt: Modern fencing is played at many levels, from students at university to professionals and Olympic competitors. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer against another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: Не мора бити одмах очигледно да је у питању унутрашње тровање. Симптоми као што је повраћање су довољно општи да се не може одмах поставити дијагноза. Најбољи показатељ унутрашњег тровања може бити присуство отвореног паковања лекова или токсичних хемикалија за домаћинство. Погледајте налепницу да бисте видели конкретна упутства за прву помоћ за тај конкретан отров.
mt: It is not always immediately obvious that it is an internal poisoning. Symptoms such as vomiting are general enough that a diagnosis cannot be immediately made. The best indicator of internal poisoning can be the presence of open packaging of medications or household toxic chemicals. Look at the label to see specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Да бисте проверили жртву, морате прво испитати лице места како бисте осигурали своју безбедност. Морате приметити положај жртве док јој се приближавате као и било које аутоматске знаке упозорења. Ако се повредите у покушају да помогнете, то ће само погоршати ситуацију.
mt: To check the victim, you must first check the scene to ensure your safety. You must note the position of the victim as you approach as well as any automatic warning signs. If you are injured in your attempt to help, it will only make the situation worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Да бисте проверили жртву, морате прво испитати лице места како бисте осигурали своју безбедност. Морате приметити положај жртве док јој се приближавате као и било које аутоматске знаке упозорења. Ако се повредите у покушају да помогнете, то ће само погоршати ситуацију.
mt: To check the victim, you must first check the scene to ensure your safety. You must note the position of the victim as you approach as well as any automatic warning signs. If you are injured in your attempt to help, it will only make the situation worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Постоји много друштвених и политичких резултата као што су употреба метричког система, прелаз из апсолутизма до републиканизма, национализам и уверење да држава припада људима, а не једном владару. Такође су након револуције занимања била отворена за све мушкарце који су се пријавили, омогућавајући најамбициознијим и најуспешнијим да успеју. Исто се односи и на војску, јер уместо да се војни чинови заснивају на класи, сада  се заснивају на калибру. Француска револуција је такође инспирисала многе потлачене људе из радничке класе у другим земљама да покрену своје сопствене револуције.
mt: There are many social and political results such as the adoption of the metric system, the transition from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief that the state belongs to the people, not one ruler. Also, after the revolution, occupations were open to all men who applied, allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. The same applies to the army, as military ranks are now based on caliber, not class. The French Revolution also inspired many oppressed people from the working class in other countries to launch their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Свако учествује у друштву и користи системе превоза. Скоро сви се жале на системе превоза. У развијеним земљама је ретко чути сличне жалбе на квалитет воде или мостове који се урушавају. Зашто транспортни системи изазивају такве притужбе и зашто свакодневно праве грешке? Да ли су инжењери транспорта једноставно неспособни? Или се дешава нешто озбиљније?
mt: Everyone participates in a society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries, it is rare to hear similar complaints about the quality of water or bridges that collapse. Why do transportation systems cause such complaints and why do they make mistakes every day? Are transportation engineers simply incompetent? Or is something more serious happening?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: Ток саобраћаја је проучавање кретања појединачних возача и возила између две тачке, као и њихове међусобне интеракције. Нажалост, проучавање саобраћајних токова је тешко зато што се понашање возача не може предвидети са стопостотном сигурношћу. На срећу, возачи се углавном понашају у оквиру разумног доследног опсега; стога саобраћајни токови имају неку разумну доследност и могу да буду представљени грубо математички. Да би се боље представио ток саобраћаја, установљене су везе између три главне карактеристике: (1) тока, (2) густине и (3) брзине. Ови односи помажу у планирању, пројектовању и раду објеката на путу.
mt: Traffic flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points, as well as their mutual interactions. Unfortunately, the study of traffic flows is difficult because the behavior of drivers cannot be predicted with 100% certainty. Fortunately, drivers generally behave within a reasonable consistent range; therefore, traffic flows have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly mathematically represented. To better represent traffic flow, relationships between three main characteristics have been established: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in planning, designing, and operating road facilities.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Херши-Чејс експеримент је био један од водећих показатеља да је ДНК генетски материјал. Херши и Чејс су користили фаге, или вирусе да убаце свој сопствени ДНК у бактерије. Урадили су два експеримента којима су обележили ДНК фага уз помоћ радиоактивног фосфора или протеин фага уз помоћ радиоактивног сумпора.
mt: The Hershey-Chase experiment was one of the leading indicators that DNA was genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to inject their own DNA into bacteria. They performed two experiments in which they labeled DNA phage with radioactive phosphorus or protein phage with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Мутације могу имати различите ефекте у зависности од типа мутације, значаја дела генетског материјала који је погођен и тога да ли су ћелије које су погођене репродуктивне ћелије. Само мутације у бацилним ћелијама могу се пренети на децу, док мутације на другим местима могу проузроковати ћелијску смрт или рак.
mt: Mutations can have different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the genetic material that is affected, and whether the affected cells are reproductive cells. Only mutations in bacterial cells can be passed on to children, while mutations in other locations can cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Чини се да су козе први пут припитомљене пре отприлике 10.000 година у планинама Загрос у Ирану. Древне културе и племена су почела да их чувају ради лакшег приступа млеку, длаци, месу и кожи. Домаће козе су углавном чуване у стадима која су лутала по брдима или другим површинама за испашу, често у пратњи козара који су углавном били деца или млади, слично познатијим пастирима. Ове методе чувања стада се и данас користе.
mt: Domestic goats were first domesticated about 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easier access to milk, hair, meat and skin. Domestic goats were usually kept in herds that roamed the hills or other grazing areas, often in the company of shepherds who were usually children or young people, similar to the better-known shepherds. These methods of herd management are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Голф је игра у којој играчи користе палице како би убацили лоптице у рупе. Осамнаест рупа се игра током регуларне рунде, а играчи обично почињу на првој рупи на терену и завршавају на осамнаестој. Победник је играч који на крају игре прими најмање удараца или  начини најмање замаха палицом. Игра се игра на трави, а трава око рупе је покошена краће и зове се „зелено“.
mt: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during the regular round, and players usually begin on the first hole on the course and end on the eighteenth. The winner is the player who at the end of the game receives the fewest strokes or makes the fewest swings of the club. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the holes is cut shorter and is called "green".
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Голф је игра у којој играчи користе палице како би убацили лоптице у рупе. src: Главни задатак науке је да схвати начин на који свет функционише користећи научни метод. Овај метод заправо управља већином научних истраживања. Међутим, експериментисање није једино, а експеримент је тест који се користи за елиминисање једне или више могућих хипотеза. Постављање питања и посматрање такође воде научно истраживање.
mt: The main task of science is to understand how the world works using the scientific method. This method actually governs most scientific research. However, experimentation is not the only one, and an experiment is a test used to eliminate one or more possible hypotheses. Asking questions and observing also lead scientific research.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Главни задатак науке је да схвати начин на који свет функционише користећи научни метод. Овај метод заправо управља већином научних истраживања. However, experimentation is not the only one, and an experiment is a test used to eliminate one or more possible hypotheses. Asking questions and observing also lead scientific research.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Торнада погађају мала подручја у поређењу са другим разорним олујама, али могу да униште све што им се нађе на путу. Торнада чупају дрвеће из корена, кидају табле са зграда и дижу аутомобиле у небо. Свега два процента торнада су најразорнија и трају више од три сата. Ветар ових чудовишних олуја иде до 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 миља на сат).
mt: Tornadoes affect small areas compared to other destructive storms, but can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes rip trees from the ground, tear off shingles from houses and lift cars into the air. Only two percent of tornadoes are the most destructive and last more than three hours. The wind of these monstrous storms can reach 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Торнада погађају мала подручја у поређењу са другим разорним олујама, али могу да униште све што им се нађе на путу. Торнада чупају дрвеће из корена, кидају табле са зграда и дижу аутомобиле у небо. Свега два процента торнада су најразорнија и трају више од три сата. Ветар ових чудовишних олуја иде до 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 миља на сат).
mt: Tornadoes affect small areas compared to other destructive storms, but can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes rip trees from the ground, tear off shingles from houses and lift cars into the air. Only two percent of tornadoes are the most destructive and last more than three hours. The wind of these monstrous storms can reach 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Људи праве и користе сочива за увећање хиљадама и хиљадама година. Међутим, први прави телескопи су направљени у Европи у касном 16. веку. Ови телескопи су користили комбинацију два сочива како би омогућили да удаљени предмети делују и ближи и већи.
mt: People have been making and using eyeglasses for magnification for thousands of years. However, the first real telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to allow distant objects to appear both closer and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: Људи праве и користе сочива за увећање хиљадама и хиљадама година. Међутим, први прави телескопи су направљени у Европи у касном 16. веку. Ови телескопи су користили комбинацију два сочива како би омогућили да удаљени предмети делују и ближи и већи.

src: Мухамед је био дубоко заинтересован за питања која су била ван његовог обичног живота. Одлазио је често да размишља у пећини која је постала позната као „Хира“ на планини „Нур“ (светлост). Сама пећина, која је преживела разна времена, даје веома јасну слику Мухамедових духовних склоности. Налазећи се на врху једне од планина северно од Меке, пећина је у потпуности изолована од остатка света. Заправо, тешко ју је пронаћи, чак и ако неко зна да постоји. Након уласка у пећину, настаје потпуна изолација. Ништа се више не може видети осим чистог, предивног неба и многобројних околних планина. Веома мало од овога света се може видети или чути из унутрашњости пећине.
mt: Muhammad was deeply interested in questions that were beyond his ordinary life. He often went to meditate in the cave that became known as "Hira" on the mountain "Nur" (light). The cave itself, which has survived various times, gives a very clear picture of Muhammad's spiritual inclinations. Located on top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is difficult to find it, even if someone knows it exists. After entering the cave, complete isolation takes place. Nothing else can be seen except for the pure, pristine sky and numerous surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: Путеви за вагоне су изграђени у Енглеској већ у 16. веку. Иако су се ране железнице састојале само од паралелних дрвених дасака, омогућавале су коњима који вуку вагоне да постигну веће брзине и повуку веће терете него на мало неравнијим путевима у то време. Железнички прагови су уведени прилично рано како би држали шине на месту. Међутим, постепено се схватило да би шине биле ефикасније кад би имале гвоздену шипку на врху. Ово је постала устаљена пракса, али је гвожђе узроковало више оштећења на дрвеним точковима кола. С временом су дрвене точкове сменили гвоздени. Године 1767. први пут су коришћене шине направљене од пуног гвожђа.
mt: Tracks for wagons were built in England as early as the 16th century. Although early railways consisted only of parallel wooden sleepers, they allowed horses pulling wagons to achieve greater speeds and pull greater loads than on the rougher roads of the time. Railway sleepers were introduced quite early to keep the rails in place. However, it gradually became apparent that rails would be more effective if they had an iron spike at the top. This became standard practice, but iron caused more damage to wooden wagon wheels. Over time wooden wheels were replaced by iron ones. In 1767 the first full iron rails were used.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
